comments.body:
please, add ignore_errors: yes for all playbooks, see @lichensky 's code for example
```suggestion
  ignore_errors: yes
  register: result
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +339,343 @@    login_user: "{{ db_user3 }}"
    login_password: password
  register: result
  ignore_errors: yes

comments.body:
I think we should check here at least that changed == true when we grant these privs
```suggestion
    login_user: "{{ pg_user }}"
    register: result
    ignore_errors: yes
    
- assert:
    that:
    - result.changed == true
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +42,46 @@    objs: dummy
    db: "{{ db_name }}"
    login_user: "{{ pg_user }}"
  register: result
  ignore_errors: yes

comments.body:
```suggestion
    login_user: "{{ pg_user }}"
    register: result
    ignore_errors: yes
    
- assert:
    that:
    - result.changed == true
```
I think we should check here at least that changed == true when we grant these privs too because maybe this actually won't return changed == true. We can't be sure if we don't check

Also, to make your test complete:
1. try to grant both privs again and check that changed == false
2. try to drop both privs and check that changed == true
3. try to drop both privs again and check that changed == false

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +136,140 @@    objs: dummy_server
    db: "{{ db_name }}"
    login_user: "{{ pg_user }}"
  register: result
  ignore_errors: yes
